H0.text: Carbon is the element that has properties most similar to calcium (Ca) based on the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H1.text: Barium [Ba] has properties most similar to calcium (Ca) according to the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H2.text: Sodium (Na) is the element whose properties are most similar to those of calcium (Ca) according to the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H3.text: Manganese (Mn) has properties most similar to calcium (Ca) based on the Periodic Table of the Elements.

A4.text: Its physical and chemical properties are most similar to its heavier homologues strontium and barium.

A5.text: Calcium, strontium, barium, and radium are always considered to be alkaline earth metals; the lighter beryllium and magnesium, also in group 2 of the periodic table, are often included as well.

A6.text: Barium is chemically similar to magnesium, calcium, and strontium, but more reactive.
